H0.text: Diabetes is a disease that is unpreventable in its type 1 form but may be prevented by diet if it is of the type 2 form.

H1.text: Obesity is a disease that is unpreventable in type one but may be prevented by diet if it is of type two.

H2.text: TB is unpreventable in the type one form but may be prevented by diet if it is of the second type.

H3.text: Cancer is a disease that is unpreventable in the type one form but may be prevented by diet if it is of the second type.

A4.text: The progression of prediabetes to overt type 2 diabetes can be slowed or reversed by lifestyle changes or medications that improve insulin sensitivity or reduce the liver's glucose production.

A5.text: Dietary changes known to be effective in helping to prevent diabetes include maintaining a diet rich in whole grains and fiber, and choosing good fats, such as the polyunsaturated fats found in nuts, vegetable oils, and fish.
